[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Standard Co-Emulation Modeling Interface (SCE-MI) defines hardware-software co-emulation requirements for real-time data exchange, synchronization, and verification.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SCE-MI supports acceleration, simulation, and real-time debugging for interoperability.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SCE-MI integrates with hardware accelerators, simulators, and debugging tools for seamless co-emulation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SCE-MI provides GUI and API access for co-emulation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SCE-MI supports FPGA platforms and accelerators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SCE-MI interoperates with standard OS and simulation frameworks for smooth integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SCE-MI secures data transfer through encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SCE-MI optimizes memory-intensive operations to support high-speed data flows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SCE-MI ensures availability with fault recovery.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SCE-MI adapts to diverse development and testing environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SCE-MI integrates with verification and debugging tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SCE-MI manages co-emulation, including data exchange, synchronization, and error recovery.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: For engineers and developers with co-emulation expertise.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SCE-MI depends on supported hardware accelerators and compliant simulation tools.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SCE-MI requires hardware, simulators, and stable networks.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with hardware accelerators for efficient data exchange (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with third-party verification tools for debugging (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall synchronize real-time hardware and software operations for accurate emulation.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide debugging support, including error detection and logging (REQ-ATTR-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall manage bidirectional data transfer between hardware and software modules.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive GUI for configuring and monitoring co-emulation workflows.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall sustain a data exchange rate of 1 GB/s between hardware and software components with a maximum latency of 5 milliseconds per transaction (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall log co-emulation tasks and results for performance analysis.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall ensure redundancy and fast retrieval of logs for debugging.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system architecture shall support modular extensions to enhance scalability and future compatibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with IEEE co-emulation standards for hardware-software verification.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale to handle increasing emulation workloads.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain detailed event logs for debugging, compliance, and auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests ensure system reliability and compliance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API docs, and troubleshooting guides.
[SEC] 5. References: IEEE standards, SCE-MI specs, and integration protocols.
